greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of labeled antichains of finite sets spanning n vertices without singletons.
comment: Also the number of antichains covering n vertices and having empty intersection (meaning there is no vertex in common to all the edges). For example, the a(3) = 5 antichains are:
xref: The binomial transform is the non-covering case A307249.
The second binomial transform is A014466.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, May 23 2018
